results.title: He who rests rusts
results.brief_description: An animated film demonstrating the necessity for consistent training and exercise in maintaining physical fitness. The champion cat athlete becomes complacent and therefore loses a challenge race.

results.title: He who calls
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Jesus in the house of Jairus; the raising of Jairus’ daughter; Salome asks for John the baptist’s head; John is murdered; Judas approaches Jesus to become his disciple.

results.title: He went to the cupboard
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Education and Andrew Buchanan
results.brief_description: A study of pantry lay-out, and the necessity for forethought in planning the use of cupboard space. Married life is subjectively represented through domestic ponderance and male ignorance of the kitchen politic.

results.title: He walked by night
results.creator_credit: Robert T Kane and Alfred L Werker
results.brief_description: In the suspenseful tradition of “The Naked City”, and drawn from the documented files of L.A.P.D. Homicide files, “He Walked by Night” is a first class suspense thriller about a desperate burglar who turns into a cop killer and is hounded down by the police. Richard Basehart is brilliant as the fearless fugitive.

results.title: He knows some things
results.brief_description: The use of colour and fluid animation suggests the innocence and carefree nature of childhood while the accompanying voice over suggests that childhood is much more complex. The work demonstrates skilfull use of rotoscoping techniques.

results.title: He died with a felafel in his hand
results.creator_credit: Notorious Films, Andrew McPhail, Domenico Procacci and Richard Lowenstein
results.brief_description: Danny (Noah Taylor), onto his 49th share house and in his mid 30s is probably ready for some privacy and independence but is still attracted to the friends and oddball characters that makes sharing a house so attractively horrible. We travel with Danny as he moves through shared houses in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. Danny’s life is further complicated by the presence of rental goons despatched by landlords in search of unpaid rent and the police chasing him in relation to a credit card debt thanks to a dodgy housemate. Proving he is not responsible is harder than lying about his identity. Based on the book of the same name by John Birmingham, `He Died With A Felafel In His Hand’ is a wonderful satire on shared housing. Cast also includes Romane Bohringer, Emily Hamilton, Sophie Lee, Alex Menglet and Damien Walshe Howling.

results.title: He acts his age [b&w]
results.creator_credit: Judith Crawley and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ages and Stages”.
How a child’s emotional development normally keeps pace with their physical growth; the behavior they exhibit at certain ages. This introductory film examines the play habits of children from one to fifteen years of age and shows the characteristics of each group.

results.title: He = On
results.brief_description: Animated film about a man’s desire to get away from his nagging wife using alcohol as his ploy. Black humour with adult themes.

results.title: He's not the walking kind
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Sandra Wilson
results.brief_description: The story of a young man who, despite a crippling malady is determined to experience as many of life’s offerings as possible. Brian Wilson is a spastic, confined to a wheelchair, but he works at a job, looks after himself, moving about from place to place on his own. Every day has its challenges and victories and sometimes defeats. An insight into the private daily struggle of the handicapped.
